abstract: Most Americans have enough difficulty building up a nest egg, and cracking it prematurely could mean living on Social Security later.
snippet: Most Americans have enough difficulty building up a nest egg, and cracking it prematurely could mean living on Social Security later.
lead_paragraph: Conventional wisdom says not to pull money out of retirement accounts except for actual retirement. Most Americans have enough difficulty building up a nest egg, and cracking it prematurely could mean living on cat food (slang for Social Security) later.

headline.main: With a Few Exceptions, the Advice Remains: Don’t Touch That Nest Egg
headline.print_headline: The Nest Egg: Nibble Early At Own Risk
